name: CheckIn
text message: We understand that spending One-on-One Time can sometimes be difficult. Here are some of the main reasons parents struggle. Which one is the closest to you?
option 2: My child did not want to spend time with me
option 3: All my child wanted to do is watch T.V. or play with a gadget
option 4: My child wanted to do things I felt uncomfortable about
option 5: My child wanted to do activities that I could not do
option 6: My child chose a competitive activity. I won and then they got angry
option 7: My child had a tantrum at the end of One-on-One Time
option 8: My child wanted to do too many things at once
option 9: All my children wanted One-on-One Time at the same time
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else. Can you think of a time each day that you can make 5 minutes or a bit more? You can even make household chores into a game to do together. Even 5 minutes can make a big difference!
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: If your child wants to do things that are too difficult for you to physically do, you can simply watch your child. Try describing what they are doing like a sports announcer and praising what they do!
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: Children often want to spend time watching T.V. or playing with a gadget. Sometimes you might want to give them some other fun options to do instead (Type: "Help" if you want a suggestion).
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: It can make you feel bad if your children do not want to spend One-on-One Time with their father. Think to yourself: When are they more open to you? Maybe in the morning or right before bedtime.
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: It can make you feel bad if your children do not want to spend One-on-One Time with you. Think to yourself: When are they more open to you? Maybe in the morning or right before bedtime.
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: Sometimes our children will suggest activities that are violent or unsafe. Explain why they can't, and try suggesting alternative activities that would be more appropriate. Type "Help" if you want a suggestion.
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: It can make you feel bad if your children do not want to spend One-on-One Time with their mother. Think to yourself: When are they more open to you? Maybe in the morning or right before bedtime.
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: If your child is very young, it is normal for them to have a short attention span and want to do many things during One-on-One Time. Just accept your child and follow their lead moving from one activity to the next.
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: You can also find something educational to do together with your child on the gadget. Or maybe ask your child to show you what is their favourite thing to do on the gadget. Just be patient. Soon they may open up to other activities, too!
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: The end of One-on-One Time can sometimes be difficult for your child. Try giving your child a Transition Warning about a minute before the end of One-on-One Time: "In one minute, One-on-One Time will be over and it will be time to wash our hands before dinner..."
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: You can also just sit next to your child while they are doing something they enjoy (like watching a T.V. show) and show them that you are interested in what they like. If you take their lead they will see that you care.
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: It can be difficult to spend One-on-One Time with each one child when you have more than one child. If possible, you can ask another adult or older sibling to look after the other children while you spend One-on-One Time with one child.
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: If your child is too young to understand how long a minute is, then you can set a number of time to repeat the activity: "5 more tries and then it will be time for wash our hands before dinner…"
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: We are sorry to hear that you have been having some difficulties spending One-on-One Time with your children. Please type "Help" for other advice that might be of use to you. Thank you for trying your best!
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message:
You can also spend One-on-One Time with all of your children at once! 
Type "Help" for activities that you can do as a whole family
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: Only give the transition warning once. When One-on-One Time is over, thank your child for spending time with you. Then enthusiastically redirect your child to the next activity like washing hands before dinner.
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: You can also think of times when it would be easier to spend One-on-One Time each child, like later in the evening with an older child after the others have gone to sleep.
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time

name: CheckIn
text message: Competitive games can be challenging for children (and adults!) if they have difficulty losing. You may want to suggest other activities that you can play together instead of against each other (Type "Help" if you want a suggestion").
name of flow: PLH - Content - Time - CheckIn - One on one time
